verse: काम्योपासनयार्थयन्त्यनुदिनं किंचित् फलं स्वेप्सितम् केचित् स्वर्गमथापवर्गमपरे योगादियज्ञादिभि: । अस्माकं यदुनन्दनांघ्रियुगलध्यानावधानार्थिनाम्, किं लोकेन दमेन किं नृपतिना स्वर्गापवर्गैश्च किम् (प्रबोध सुधाकर)

terms.योगादियज्ञादिभि:: through practices like yoga and sacrifices
terms.यदुनन्दनांघ्रियुगलध्यानावधानार्थिनाम्: who are engaged in meditation on the feet of Yadu's descendant (Krishna)

meaning: This verse from Prabodha Sudhakara questions the purpose and significance of different pursuits undertaken by people. Some engage in pursuing their desires, others in the goal of attaining heaven or liberation through various practices, while only a few devotees concentrate their minds on the lotus feet of Lord Krishna. The verse emphasizes the futility of worldly pleasures, self": "control, and even goals like heaven or liberation compared to the devotion and focus on the divine feet of Lord Krishna. It poses a rhetorical question, asking what is the real benefit achieved through these pursuits.
